theory: Gin will return to meet the Straw Hats again, particularly Sanji, fulfilling his promise to Luffy at the end of the Baratie Arc. Many fans speculated he would appear at major events like Wano or Big Mom's Tea Party.
author: One Piece Fan Community
statusNote: Confirmed in Chapter 1117 (Episode 1150) - Gin appears alive on Pirate Island in the New World, having survived and made it to the New World with the Krieg Pirates.

theory: Gin died from inhaling the poisonous gases of Don Krieg's MH5 bomb during the Baratie Arc, which is why he was never seen again for over 25 years.
author: One Piece Fan Community
statusNote: This theory was debunked when Gin appeared alive in Chapter 1117. Additionally, Oda revealed Gin's birthday in Volume 81 SBS in 2015, suggesting he hadn't forgotten about the character.

theory: Gin is actually Admiral Ryokugyu (Green Bull) or Killer (Eustass Kid's right-hand man), having taken on a new identity after the Baratie Arc.
author: One Piece Fan Community
statusNote: This theory has been completely debunked with Gin's reappearance as himself in Chapter 1117, confirming he remained with the Krieg Pirates.

theory: Sanji's act of feeding Gin foreshadows his lifelong philosophy about feeding anyone in need, regardless of their allegiance. This moment establishes a core character trait that will be tested multiple times throughout the series.
author: One Piece Analysis Community
statusNote: This is more of a thematic observation than a theory, but it has been confirmed throughout the series as Sanji consistently feeds enemies and allies alike.

theory: Gin's gratitude to Sanji will lead to a crucial moment where Gin must choose between his loyalty to Don Krieg and his debt to Sanji, creating one of the arc's emotional climaxes.
author: Early One Piece Viewers
statusNote: This foreshadowing was proven correct in later episodes of the Baratie Arc when Gin refuses to kill Sanji despite Krieg's orders.
